title: Introduction to Network Security: Understanding Intrusion Detection Systems

context.prior_knowledge: Expert-level knowledge and experience in solving complex problems
context.additional_context: A basic security education course for digitally underserved populations, focusing on network threats in daily life and simple response methods

learning_goals: Learners can distinguish at least three common types of basic network attacks (e.g., phishing, malware) that may occur in daily life
After listening to explanations of intrusion detection system (IDS) principles and security functions, learners can describe at least five key terms (e.g., firewall, real-time detection)
Learners can apply and execute at least three simple security practices (e.g., verifying suspicious links, regular updates) in smartphone environments

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
